perturbation.original_text: The Company shall maintain complete and accurate records of the number of packages shipped by the MBE Centers using the Service and all payments due or accrued to the Company by MBE Centers hereunder. MBE shall, at any time during the term of this Agreement, be entitled to audit all such records upon ten (10) days written notice to the Company, in order to confirm the accuracy of such records and conformance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement; provided, however, that no more than one (1) such audit may be conducted in any -------- ------- ninety (90)-day period. Any such audit shall be performed at MBE's expense during the Company's normal business hours; provided, however, that in the event -------- ------- that such audit reveals any non-compliance with any term of this Agreement by the Company, the Company shall bear the cost of such audit.
perturbation.changed_text: The Company shall maintain complete and accurate records of the number of packages shipped by the MBE Centers using the Service and all payments due or accrued to the Company by MBE Centers hereunder. MBE shall, at any time during the term of this Agreement, be entitled to audit all such records upon ten (10) days written notice to the Company, in order to confirm the accuracy of such records and conformance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement; provided, however, that no more than one (1) such audit may be conducted in any -------- ------- thirty (30)-day period. Any such audit shall be performed at MBE's expense during the Company's normal business hours; provided, however, that in the event -------- ------- that such audit reveals any non-compliance with any term of this Agreement by the Company, the Company shall bear the cost of such audit.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by stating that MBE can only conduct audits every 30 days in one section, while the original contract stipulated a 90-day period, making it uncertain how frequently audits can occur.

perturbation.original_text: MBE agrees to use its commercially reasonable efforts to execute agreements, or to facilitate the execution of agreements among the appropriate parties, so that such Basic Fee is paid to the Company directly from the carrier which ships such package no later than fifteen (15) days following the end of the month in which such package was shipped. If MBE is unable, despite its commercially reasonable efforts, to facilitate the execution of such an agreement with one or more carriers, the Basic Fee shall be paid by each MBE Center directly pursuant to the terms of the Subscription Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: MBE agrees to use its commercially reasonable efforts to execute agreements, or to facilitate the execution of agreements among the appropriate parties, so that such Basic Fee is paid to the Company directly from the carrier which ships such package no later than thirty (30) days following the end of the month in which such package was shipped. If MBE is unable, despite its commercially reasonable efforts, to facilitate the execution of such an agreement with one or more carriers, the Basic Fee shall be paid by each MBE Center directly pursuant to the terms of the Subscription Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by extending the deadline for carriers to pay Basic Fees to 30 days, which conflicts with the initial payment deadline of 15 days. It's unclear which deadline should be enforced, especially if carriers fail to meet the 15-day deadline but argue they have 30 days.

perturbation.original_text: Within thirty (30) days after the Termination Completion Date, each party shall, at its own expense, destroy or return to the Company and make no further use of, any property, materials or other items of the other party and shall certify, in writing that it has done so
perturbation.changed_text: Within ninety (90) days after the Termination Completion Date, each party shall, at its own expense, destroy or return to the Company and make no further use of, any property, materials or other items of the other party and shall certify, in writing that it has done so
perturbation.explanation: This change modifies the deadline to return materials, creating a contradiction as to whether it should be done within 30 or 90 days. This introduces uncertainty and potential legal issues regarding compliance after termination.
